missing_required_argument.title: You didn't provide all the arguments!
missing_required_argument.footer: Still not working? Ask in the support server!

errors.command_on_cooldown: **You're on cooldown!** Please try again in {0}s
errors.max_concurrency_reached: This command is experiencing exceptional traffic. **Please try again in a few seconds.**
errors.missing_permissions: **You're missing permissions required to do this!** You need {0}
errors.no_private_message: This command can only be used **inside a server!**

command_not_found.title: This command doesn't exist!
command_not_found.footer: If you believe this is an error, please contact support.

embed_pages_permission_error.title: I don't have the permissions required!
embed_pages_permission_error.description:
This command requires a little magic to work.
**I need to be able to manage messages!**
embed_pages_permission_error.footer: Adjust my permissions and try again.

errors.bot_missing_permissions:
**I don't have the permissions required to do this!**
I need: {0}
errors.channel_not_found:
I can't seem to find a channel named `{0}`...
**Does it exist and do I have access?**
errors.role_not_found: I can't seem to find a role named `{0}`...

checks.bot_cant_manage_release_feed_channels: **I can't manage (each of) the release feed channels** configured in this server! Set the right permissions for me and try again.
checks.guild_has_no_release_feeds: **This server doesn't have any release feeds configured!** Use `{0}` to add one.

errors.use_in_private: For your safety, use this command **only in a DM with me, or via a slash command!**
errors.github_auth_pending: You already have a GitHub authorization pending! **Please complete it first.**
errors.command_disabled: This command is currently **disabled!** Check back in soon or ask around in the support server.

events.mention:
:tada: **Hi! I'm GitBot.**
My prefix is `git`
Type `git help` for a list of my commands.

user.qa: You don't have a quick access user configured! **Type** `git config` **to do it.**
user.qa_changed: The user you had saved has changed their name or deleted their account. Please **re-add them** using `git config user`

repo.or_ref: This repository **doesn't exist** or the ref {0} **doesn't exist within it!**
repo.qa: You don't have a quick access repo configured! **Type** `git config` **to do it.**
repo.qa_changed: The repo you had saved has changed its name or has been deleted. Please **re-add it** using `git config repo`
repo.saved_repo_unavailable: You invoked the command with your stored repo, but it's unavailable. **Please re-add it.**
repo.no_pulls_with_state: This repo doesn't have any **{0} pull requests!**
repo.no_issues_with_state: This repo doesn't have any **{0} issues!**
repo.no_pulls_with_state_qa: Your saved repo doesn't have any **{0} pull requests!**
repo.no_issues_with_state_qa: Your saved repo doesn't have any **{0} issues!**

org.qa: You don't have a quick access organization configured! **Type** `git config` **to do it.**
org.qa_changed: The organization you had saved has changed its name or was deleted. Please **re-add it** using `git config org`

repos.user: This user doesn't have any **public repos!**
repos.org: This organization doesn't have any **public repos!**

nonexistent.gist: This user doesn't have any **public gists!**
nonexistent.pr_number: A pull request with this number **doesn't exist!**
nonexistent.issue_number: An issue with this number **doesn't exist!**
nonexistent.qa: **You don't have any quick access data configured!** Use `git config` to do it
nonexistent.python_package: A Python package with this name doesn't exist on PyPI!
nonexistent.rust_crate: A Rust crate with this name doesn't exist on crates.io!
nonexistent.release_feed: This server **doesn't have any Release Feeds!** (Use this command after adding one)
nonexistent.commit: A commit with this OID **doesn't exist** in {0}!
nonexistent.command: **I couldn't find that command!** Re-check the spelling?
nonexistent.group: **I couldn't find that command group!** Re-check the spelling?
nonexistent.command_or_group: **I couldn't find that command/group!** Re-check the spelling?
nonexistent.release_feed_with_mention: This server doesn't have any **Release Feeds with a mention configured!**

issue.invalid_state: `{0}` is not a **valid issue state!** (Try `open` or `closed`)

pr.invalid_state: `{0}` is not a **valid pull request state!** (Try `open`, `closed` or `merged`)

generic.invalid_index: {0} is not a valid number **from the list!**
generic.unspecified: **Something went wrong,** please report this in the support server.
generic.inactive: The command timed out - this message is no longer active!
generic.completed: The command has been completed - this message is no longer active
generic.closed: This command has been closed - you can't interact with it anymore
generic.failure: The command didn't finish - this message is no longer active

legal.title: GitBot Legal
legal.description:
**Thanks for being a user of GitBot!**
If you wish to take a look at the legal documents governing your use of GitBot, check out [**the legal page.**](https://statch.org/gitbot/legal.html)
legal.footer: For any further questions, please join the support server.

stats.title: Bot Stats
stats.body: General stats regarding the Bot's functioning.

people.title: People
people.body:
I'm in **{0}** servers,
and have **{1}** users

code.title: Code
code.body:
I am **{0}** lines of code,
running on **{1}**

info.no_info: I couldn't fetch any info regarding the link you provided!

snippets.length_limit_exceeded: I cannot show **more than {0} lines**, sorry!
snippets.no_content: There **isn't any content** on these lines!
snippets.no_lines_mentioned: The link has to be a GitHub or GitLab URL **mentioning lines!**

forks.no_forks: No one has forked this repo, yet

Ten latest gists from {0}.
To inspect a specific gist, simply select it in the dropdown.
gist.content_notice: The content is a preview of the first file of the gist

participants.plural: {0} people have participated in this issue

with_count.plural: {0} entries matching .gitbot.json ignore rules were removed.
with_count.singular: One entry matching .gitbot.json ignore rules was removed.

footer.credit: This command is powered by the CLOC CLI tool.

embed.title: Latest commits in {0}
embed.footer: You can select the commit you wish to view from the dropdown.

commits.empty: I **couldn't fetch any latest commits** from this repo!

info.name: Info

valid.github: Signed with a valid signature issued by GitHub
valid.user: Signed with a valid signature by {0}

info.committed_via_web: This commit was made via the web interface

commit.footer_latest: This is the latest commit from your quick-access repo

logs.dm_failed: **I can't send you a DM**, so we can't proceed. Process aborted, webhook deleted.
logs.description:
To configure repo logs, you have to add a webhook to your repo of choice.
To do that, **follow the step-by-step instructions below.**
instructions: Navigate to your repo and open the settings
Paste the URL you just received in your DMs as the `Payload URL`
logs.footer: And that's it! You will now receive a notification whenever there's a new event!
logs.webhook_failed: **Webhook creation failed.** Try verifying my permissions!

default.brief_1: **In this section you can configure various aspects of your experience**
default.title: **Quick Access**
default.brief_2: These commands allow you to save a user, repo or org to get with a short command.

commands.user: Access a saved user with `git user`
commands.org: Access a saved organization with `git org`
commands.repo: Access a saved repo with `git repo`
commands.feed: Subscribe to new releases of a repository

default.deletion: **You can delete stored data by typing** `git config delete`
default.footer: To see what you have saved, use git config show

base.title: Your GitBot Config
base.footer: To view release feed repos, type {0}

feed.title: This server's release feeds
feed.footer: You can add a feed with {0}

default.title: Automatic Conversions
default.description: **These settings allow you to customize how GitBot converts some of your messages**

embed.title: GitHub Line link conversion
embed.description: You can set what you want to happen when a GitHub line link is sent in the chat by simply responding with a number corresponding to the option you want to choose!

options.codeblock: Convert GitHub line links into plaintext codeblocks

timeout_embed.title: Timed Out
timeout_embed.footer: Simply send the option number next time!

results.0: Automatic GitHub line link conversion **turned OFF!**
results.1: GitHub line links will now automatically be converted **into codeblocks!**
results.2: GitHub line links will now automatically be converted **into Carbon images!**

gh_lines.cancelled: GitHub line link conversion setting change **cancelled!**
gh_lines.invalid_response: **That's not a valid setting!** Try again by sending a number!

feed.no_perms:
**I am missing required permissions in that channel!**
I need `manage webhooks` and `manage channel`
feed.no_arg: Please pass in a repository which you wish to follow!
feed.already_logged: This repo's releases are **already being logged!**
feed.success: New **{0}** releases will now be logged.
feed.not_a_feed: {0} is **not a release feed!** Try again?

default.title: Repository Release Feeds

channel.already_taken: This channel is already configured as a Release Feed!
channel.invalid_channel: **That is not a valid channel!** Try again.

success_embed.title: Success!
success_embed.description:
{0} has been **added as a release feed.**
Use {1} to add a repo to the new feed.

channel_limit_reached_embed.title: Release Feed Channel limit reached!
channel_limit_reached_embed.description: This guild has reached the **limit of 5 release feed channels.** You can remove a previously added channel by typing `git config delete feed channel`
channel_limit_reached_embed.footer: You need the Manage Channels permission to do that.

channel_list_embed.title: Pick a Release Feed:
channel_list_embed.footer: To pick one, simply send its number/mention below!

timeout_embed.title: Timed Out
timeout_embed.footer: Simply send a channel number/mention next time!

channel_at_limit_embed.title: Release feed repo limit reached!
channel_at_limit_embed.description:
Sorry, {0} is at the 10 repo limit.
**You can try:**
{emoji_square} adding {1} to a different release feed
{emoji_square} deleting another repo to make space
channel_at_limit_embed.footer: Type {0} to delete a repo from this feed

repo.invalid_channel: {0} is not a valid **channel number/mention** from the list! Send another one, or type `cancel` to exit.
repo.success: New {0} releases will now be logged in {1}!
repo.cancelled: Adding a repo to the release feed **cancelled.**

select.placeholder: Select a number of releases to fetch

backlog.how_many: How many releases would you like to fetch?
backlog.fetching: Fetching a backlog of available releases...
backlog.fetched: **Done!** I managed to fetch a backlog of `{0}` releases; they're waiting in {1} right now.
backlog.no_backlog: The repo doesn't have any releases to fetch, so your feed will be empty for now.

embed.title: Set a mention for releases in {0}
embed.description:
Set the mention to be sent along with the message when a release is created, to get the attention of anyone interested.

**Send the correct mention to set it.** You can also:
{emoji_square} type "everyone" or "here" for these mentions
{emoji_square} send a role's ID to set it without mentioning the role itself

mention.cancelled: Setting a mention for releases in {0} **cancelled.**
mention.invalid: That is not a valid mention/ID! **Try again.**
mention.success: New releases in {0} will now be sent with {1}!

match_confirmation_embed.title: Confirm Language
match_confirmation_embed.description: Your requested language didn't match any of the available ones in full, but it was **very close to `{0}`**. Did you mean to choose that one?
match_confirmation_embed.footer: React with an appropriate emoji to pick an option!

timeout_embed.title: Timed Out
timeout_embed.footer: Simply pick an option next time!

locale.title: Bot Language

default.title: Delete Quick Access Data
default.description: **You can delete stored quick access data by running the following commands:**

commands.feed: view options regarding deleting release feed data
commands.all: delete all of your quick access data

feed.no_channel: You don't have a release feed channel configured!
feed.nothing_deleted: You don't have a release feed configured, so **nothing was deleted.**

default.title: Delete Release Feed data
default.description: **You can delete stored release feed data by running the following commands:**

commands.total: unsubscribe from all releases and delete the feed webhook

repo.not_present_in_feed: This repo **isn't being logged** in any of your release feeds!

embed.title: Release feeds with {0} present
embed.description: Respond with the **channel name/number(s)** to delete {0} from.

success.title: Release feeds updated!
success.description: {0} **has been removed** from the following feeds:
success.optional_footer: Only {0} feeds have been updated, because some were invalid

multiple.no_feeds_mentioned: You didn't mention any **existing feeds or their numbers!** Try again, or quit by typing `cancel`

embed.title: Deleting {0} from a release feed
embed.description: Do you really want to remove {0} from {1}?

single.cancelled: Nothing changed, {0} releases are **still being logged.**
single.success: {0} releases will no longer be logged in {1}

total.success: The release feed channel has been **closed successfully.**

channel.not_a_feed: {0} is **not configured as a release feed!**
channel.invalid_channel: That's **not a valid channel!** Try again.

embed.title: Are you sure?
embed.description:
**Do you really want to remove {0} from your release feeds?**
{1} repos' releases are logged there as of now; this is irreversible.
embed.footer: React with the appropriate emote to choose what to do.

confirmation.success: All done. {0} **has been removed from your release feeds.**

embed.title: Delete a mention from a release feed
embed.description: Type the **channel name/number** of a feed to delete the mention associated with it!

mention.cancelled: Deletion of a mention from a release feed **cancelled.**
mention.invalid: That is not a valid channel/channel number from the list! **Try again.**

user.not_saved: You don't have a user saved!

org.not_saved: You don't have an organization saved!

repo.not_saved: You don't have a repo saved!

all.success: All of your stored data was **successfully deleted.**
all.not_saved: It appears that **you don't have anything stored!**

support.title: GitBot Support Server
support.description: If you have any problems, feel free to join the [support server.](https://discord.statch.org)

help.no_arguments_footer: This command doesn't take any arguments. You're good to go!

default.title: GitBot Help
default.description:
Here you'll find a list of all the commands that GitBot has to offer.
**You can use `git help [command]` to get more information about a specific command.**

fields.name: Argument style
fields.value:
When a command accepts input, it will be shown in one of the following ways:
{emoji_square}  `[argument]` - for **optional** arguments
{emoji_square}  `<argument>` - for **required** arguments

fields.name: Quick-access
fields.value: Some commands utilize your saved users, repos, orgs, etc. to make their syntax shorter. If that's the case - it will be mentioned in the command's help footer, and you can skip the corresponding argument.

no_help_for_command.title: Uh oh!
no_help_for_command.description:
This command does exist, **but there isn't any help for it as of yet!**
If you're unsure how to use it, you can join the [support server](https://discord.statch.org) and **ask for help.**

repo.brief: Get info about a GitHub repo
repo.description: This command group provides many useful commands ranging from overall info and stats, to downloading and inspecting a repo's code.

repo_download.brief: Download the code of a GitHub repo

commits.brief: Get latest commits from a GitHub repository

config.brief: A command group responsible for setting and viewing GitBot's options
config.description: Some of the settings are server-wide, so to adjust them you'll need specific permissions

config_show.description: If used inside a server, displays server-wide options as well

config_show_feed.brief: View repos that are logged in the server's release feeds

config_repo.description: Setting this will allow you to use certain commands that take in a repository in a shorter way (ex. git repo statch/gitbot -> git repo)

config_lang.description: If this command is used without a language name, it will display a list of available languages to choose from

config_feed.brief: A command group used for creating and managing repository release feeds
config_feed.description: You can use commands in this group to set channels as release "feeds", add repos to them, and then get notified whenever a new release is created!

config_feed_repo.brief: Add a repo to a release feed
config_feed_repo.description: This command will display a list of your release feeds and ask you to choose which feed the repo should be added to

config_feed_channel.description: This command will allow you to add a channel as a release feed, to then add repos and wait for new releases. You can have 5 of these in your server!

config_user.description: Setting this will allow you to use certain commands that take in a user in a shorter way (ex. git user itsmewulf -> git user)

config_delete.brief: A command group responsible for deleting GitBot config values
config_delete.description: Commands in this group allow you to reset config fields to their default values or delete items from feeds

config_delete_repo.description: This command will tell GitBot to "forget" your saved repo, so commands will no longer use the shortened syntax

config_delete_feed.brief: A command group responsible for deleting saved feed channels or repos logged in these channels

config_delete_feed_channel.brief: A command responsible for deleting a release feed channel
config_delete_feed_channel.description: You can use this command to delete a previously added release feed channel. Deleting a feed means that releases from repos previously bound to that feed will no longer arrive.

config_delete_feed_repo.brief: A command used to delete a repo from a release feed
config_delete_feed_repo.description: This command allows you to delete a repository from a specific release feed channel. Once deleted, new releases of this repo will no longer arrive in this feed. Other feeds following this repo won't be affected.

config_delete_language.brief: Reset your GitBot language to default
config_delete_language.description: This command will reset GitBot's language to English

config_delete_user.description: This command will tell GitBot to "forget: your saved user, so commands will no longer use the shortened syntax

config_delete_all.brief: Delete all config values bound to your GitBot profile
config_delete_all.description: This command doesn't affect server settings.

config_delete_org.description: This command will tell GitBot to "forget" your saved org, so commands will no longer use the shortened syntax

config_org.description: Setting this will allow you to use certain commands that take in an organization in a shorter way (ex. git org statch -> git org)

config_autoconv.brief: A command group for configuring GitBot's automatic behaviors
config_autoconv.description: Subcommands in this group control server-wide settings that affect GitBot's autonomy - mainly automatically converting GitHub links to information, creating Carbon images from codeblocks and more!

config_autoconv_link.description: This command toggles the automatic resolving of links sent in chat (except for line links). GitBot will reply to messages with links it understands with information about what's on the other end of that URL

config_autoconv_lines.brief: Toggle automatic GitHub Line link resolving
config_autoconv_lines.description: This command, not to be confused with general URL resolving, manages only the line aspect of URLs. When a link containing line mentions (ex. #L9-L42) is sent in chat, GitBot will attempt to convert it into either a codeblock, or an image, based on your selection

config_autoconv_codeblock.brief: Toggle automatic codeblock to Carbon image conversion

commit.description: Get detailed info about a GitHub commit. If you have a quick-access repo set, you can use this command with only the oid argument, or without arguments altogether - it will default to your saved repo and the latest commit. You can also pass just the repo - the latest commit will be returned

logs.brief: Get commit feeds in the current channel
logs.description: This command creates a webhook (a fancy name for a not-so-fancy thing), that's then sent to you along with instructions to get the feed up and running. You add the URL from the instructions into repo(s) of choice, and you get all the commits right as they happen!

org.brief: Get info about a GitHub organization
org.description: This command group allows you to view info about an org, its repos, and more!

org_info.brief: Get info about a GitHub organization
org_info.description: Get detailed information about an org - when it was created, who the members are, how many repos it has, and more!

org_repos.brief: Get a list of an organization's repos

legal.brief: The GitBot Privacy Policy and TOS

support.brief: Get support if you ran into a problem, or simply want to chat!

snippet.brief: Convert a codeblock or a GitHub line link into a Carbon image

snippet_raw.brief: Get the content of a GitHub line link in the form of a codeblock

pypi.description: This command group allows you to view info about PyPI packages such as creation date, downloads and more!

pypi_downloads.brief: Get a 3-month download chart for a PyPI package

pypi_info.brief: Get info about a PyPI package

repo_issues.brief: Get issues in a GitHub repo
repo_issues.description: This command allows you to list issues with the given state ("open" and "closed"; "open" is the default) in a specific repository. The command returns a list of the 10 latest issues that match the search criteria.

repo_info.brief: Get info about a GitHub repo

repo_pulls.brief: Get pull requests in a GitHub repo
repo_pulls.description: This command allows you to list PRs with the given state ("open", "closed", or "merged"; "open" is the default") in a specific repository. A list of the 10 latest PRs that match the search criteria is returned.

repo_files.brief: View a GitHub repo's file structure
repo_files.description: With a saved quick-access repo, you can directly access subdirectories without typing out the full name, e.g. repo files /lib/api (start with a /)

repo_commits.brief: Get latest commits from a GitHub repository

invite.brief: Invite the bot to your server!

pr.brief: Get info about a Pull Request

vote.description: Voting massively helps GitBot reach as many devs as possible!

user.brief: Get info about a GitHub user
user.description: Commands inside this group allow you to view info about a user, their repos, and more!

user_info.brief: Get info about a GitHub user
user_info.description: Get detailed info about a GitHub user - contributions, orgs, repos, and more!

gist.brief: Get a gist authored by a GitHub user
gist.description: This command shows you a list of a user's latest gists, from which you can pick one to inspect by sending its number. You can also use it with both a username and a number corresponding to a gist from the list to skip the dialog.

loc.brief: Lines-of-code breakdown of a GitHub repo
loc.description: How many Python lines? How many comments? How much blank space? You'll find the answers right here.

repo_loc.brief: Lines-of-code breakdown of a GitHub repo
repo_loc.description: How many Python lines? How many comments? How much blank space? You'll find the answers right here.

issue.description: Find out what an issue is about, the participants, labels, and a whole lot more!

help.description: This is the command you're using right now!

license.description: Find out what an open-source license is all about - its permissions, conditions, limitations, and more!

ping.description: Ping is the time it takes a message to travel from Discord to GitBot, and vice versa

config_feed_mention.brief: Configure a mention for new repo releases
config_feed_mention.description: Pick who (roles/everyone/here) to ping when a new release comes out in a release feed!

crates.description: This command group allows you to view info about Rust crates published to crates.io, such as creation date, authors, downloads and more!

crates_downloads.brief: Get download stats of a crates.io crate

crates_info.brief: Get info about a crates.io crate

config_delete_feed_mention.brief: Delete a mention from a release feed
config_delete_feed_mention.description: Too pingy? Delete the mention you previously configured for a release feed and enjoy the silence!

file.brief: A command group with utilities for dealing with files!

file_hash.brief: Get the hash of a file
file_hash.description: Get a file hash of the provided file generated via the specified algorithm

file_verify.brief: Verify the integrity of a file
file_verify.description: Verify the integrity of a file against a checksum generated via the specified algorithm

auth.brief: Authorize with various services to access more features!
auth.description: Connect your other accounts to GitBot to access an extended set of features.

auth_github.brief: Authorize with GitHub to access more features!
auth_github.description:
Connect your GitHub account to GitBot to access an extended set of features!
This command can only be used in DMs or as a slash command.

version.brief: Get the current version of GitBot

repo_with_branch.name: repo-with-branch
repo_with_branch.content: The repo and branch separated by a `/` character (ex. `statch/gitbot/v3`). If the branch is omitted, the default one is used (`statch/gitbot/main`)

repo.name: repo
repo.content: The name of the repository in the `owner/name` format (ex. `statch/gitbot`)

repo_or_subcommand.name: repo-or-subcommand
repo_or_subcommand.content: Either a repository name in the `owner/name` format, or another subcommand from this group

user_or_subcommand.name: user-or-subcommand
user_or_subcommand.content: Either a GitHub username, or another subcommand from this group

user.name: user
user.content: The name of a GitHub user (ex. `itsmewulf`)

org.name: org
org.content: The name of a GitHub organization (ex. `statch`)

subcommand.name: subcommand
subcommand.content: The name of another command in this group

channel.name: channel
channel.content: The name, mention or ID of a channel in this server (ex. `#general`)

oid.name: oid
oid.content: A Git object ID (ex. `3546fa7faada2c61d0a0edf3ec09e1fc28ed7677`) that corresponds to an object - a commit, tree, blob, tag, etc.

org_or_subcommand.name: org-or-subcommand
org_or_subcommand.content: Either an organization name, or another subcommand from this group

codeblock_or_lines.name: codeblock-or-lines
codeblock_or_lines.content: Either a codeblock, or a GitHub line link (ex. https://github.com/statch/gitbot/blob/main/bot.py#L1-L12)

rust_crate_name.name: rust-package-name
rust_crate_name.content: The name of a Rust crate (ex. `tokio`)

python_package_name.name: python-package-name
python_package_name.content: The name of a Python package (ex. `py-carbon`)

issue_state.name: issue-state
issue_state.content: The state of the issue (eg. `open` or `closed`)

gist_list_number.name: gist-list-number
gist_list_number.content: A number corresponding to a gist from the list

command.name: command
command.content: The name of one of GitBot's commands

license_name.name: license-name
license_name.content: The name of an open-source license (ex. `MIT`)

hashing_algorithm.name: hashing-algorithm
hashing_algorithm.content: The name of a GitBot-supported hashing algorithm (ex. `sha256`)

checksum.name: checksum
checksum.content: A checksum (hash) generated via the specified hashing algorithm

file.name: file
file.content: Apart from the parameters, this command also **requires a file** to be provided. Simply type your command, then add a file to the message!

ref.name: ref
ref.content: A git reference (ex. `main`, a branch, or a commit hash)

repo_with_path.name: repo-with-path
repo_with_path.content: The repo and path separated by a `/` character (ex. `statch/gitbot/lib/api`). The path can be omitted, in which case the root of the repo is used (`statch/gitbot`)

qa_disclaimers.repo:
This command can be used without the repo argument if you have a repo saved!
Use git config to check it out!
qa_disclaimers.user:
This command can be used without the user argument if you have a user saved!
Use git config to check it out!
qa_disclaimers.org:
This command can be used without the org argument if you have an organization saved!
Use git config to check it out!

help.hybrid_disclaimer: This is a hybrid command - it can be used both normally and as a slash command.

default.title: GitBot Development Commands
default.description: Commands in this group are meant to be used by **GitBot's maintainers** and **contributors** to its GitHub repository.
default.footer: If you'd like to contribute yourself, click the link in this embed's title.

commands.missing_locales: get a list of missing (non-translated) keys for a locale

missing_locales.no_master_locale: No missing keys for the {0} locale can be found because it's the Master Locale.
missing_locales.no_missing_keys: This locale doesn't have any missing keys! :tada:
missing_locales.title: Missing keys in `{0}`

export_commands.invalid_format:
**You can't export to that format!**
Please choose one of the following: {0}

default.title: Python Package Index Commands
default.description:
Commands in this group are related to PyPI,
the package index for Python.
Below you can find a list of the commands in this group.

commands.downloads: Get download stats of a package

downloads.title: {0} downloads over the last {1} days
downloads.footer: PyPi project statistics are provided by pypistats.org

default.title: Crates.io Commands
default.description:
Commands in this group are related to [crates.io](https://crates.io),
the Rust package index.
Below you can find a list of the commands in this group.

downloads.title: {0} downloads over the last {1} days
downloads.footer: Project statistics are fetched directly from crates.io

invalid_algorithm_embed.title: Invalid hashing algorithm!
invalid_algorithm_embed.footer: If you'd like a specific algorithm to be supported, please contact the devs in the support server.

hash.no_file: You need to send this command **along with a file to hash!**

verify.no_file: You need to send this command **along with a file to verify!**

github.title: Authorize with GitHub
github.description:
Connect your GitHub account with GitBot in order to access extended functionality.
**Click the button below to get started!**

overwrite_confirmation.title: Are you sure?
overwrite_confirmation.description:
You already have a GitHub account connected: {0}.
**Do you wish to overwrite it?**
overwrite_confirmation.footer: Click the appropriate button below to confirm/cancel.
